sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: IonQ Crushes Q4 Estimates— Rigetti, Quantum Computing On Deck
feed.summary: IonQ (NYSE: IONQ) significantly exceeded its fourth-quarter revenue estimates, reporting $61.9 million, a 429% increase year-over-year, and became the first pure-play quantum firm to reach $100 million in annual revenue. This performance has boosted the entire quantum computing sector, demonstrating commercial viability and investor confidence. While D-Wave Quantum (NYSE: QBTS) reported a revenue miss, it showed strong bookings growth, and the quantum community now looks to upcoming reports from Rigetti Computing (NASDAQ: RGTI) and Quantum Computing (NASDAQ: QUBT) to gauge continued sector momentum.

feed.title: Meta Platforms CFO Li sells $35.3 million in stock By Investing.com
feed.summary: Meta Platforms CFO Susan J. Li sold 58,478 shares of Class A Common Stock for approximately $35.3 million on February 24, 2026, through a trust. These transactions were executed under a pre-arranged trading plan. Despite the insider sale, Meta maintains strong financial health with high gross profit margins, and its stock is considered slightly undervalued according to InvestingPro analysis, while the company also faces legal actions against scam advertisers and has secured an agreement with AMD for AI infrastructure.

feed.title: Emerson Electric Shares Surge 2.88% on Strong Earnings and Guidance Hike Despite $400M Volume Ranking 349th
feed.summary: Emerson Electric (EMR) shares rose by 2.88% after the company reported strong Q1 2026 earnings, surpassing EPS estimates and matching revenue projections. The company also raised its full-year guidance, forecasting increased EPS and annual sales growth, driven by strategic initiatives and alignment with secular tailwinds like electrification and energy security. Investor confidence was further boosted by a $250 million share repurchase program, a $10 billion shareholder return target by 2028, and upward adjustments to price targets by analysts.

feed.title: Electronic Arts fails to win bondholder support for buyback -- Bloomberg
feed.summary: The article states that Electronic Arts (EA) failed to secure bondholder support for a proposed buyback, as reported by Bloomberg. No further details are provided in the given

feed.title: Tesla Cybertruck's Ultra-Hard Cold-Rolled Steel Confirmed By Musk
feed.summary: Tesla has applied for a patent for an "Ultra-Hard Cold-Worked Steel Alloy" which CEO Elon Musk confirmed is for the Cybertruck's unique exoskeleton. This cold-rolled stainless steel material will make the Cybertruck distinct and will not be painted. While production is expected to begin soon, the supplier of this new metal has not been officially announced, though Steel Dynamics is a rumored candidate.

feed.title: Avidity Advances RNA Programs and Expands into New Therapeutic Areas Utilizing its AOC™ Platform
feed.summary: Avidity Biosciences announced the expansion of its RNA therapeutic discovery pipeline, adding new research and development candidates in skeletal muscle and cardiology. The company is leveraging its proprietary AOC platform to target previously untreatable diseases and continues to advance three rare disease programs in Phase 1/2 clinical development for myotonic dystrophy type 1 (DM1), facioscapulohumeral muscular dystrophy (FSHD), and Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD). Avidity also maintains collaborations with Eli Lilly and Company and MyoKardia to further explore its AOC platform's potential.

feed.title: Halliburton’s Oilfield Services Pivot: What US Energy Buyers Need To Know
feed.summary: Halliburton is strategically shifting its oilfield services model in the US, emphasizing digital technologies, efficiency, and higher-margin services, particularly in North American shale. This pivot aims to optimize drilling, completions, and production support, impacting pricing, contract terms, and supply chain dynamics for energy buyers. The company's focus on capital discipline and shareholder returns suggests tighter capacity cycles and sophisticated service bundles for B2B customers.

feed.title: Argus Upgrades Deckers Outdoor Corporation (DECK) to Buy from Hold
feed.summary: Argus upgraded Deckers Outdoor Corporation (DECK) to Buy from Hold, citing strong sales growth for its UGG and HOKA brands and management's raised guidance. This follows other analyst upgrades and price target increases after Deckers reported a robust Q3, with record revenue and EPS driven by global demand for its key brands. The company's strategic marketplace management and strong full-price selling contributed to its profitable growth.

feed.title: Piper Sandler Lowers Green Thumb Industries Rating & Price Target Before Q4 Earnings Release
feed.summary: Piper Sandler downgraded Green Thumb Industries (CNSX: GTII) (OTCMKTS: GTBIF) from 'Overweight' to 'Neutral' and cut its price target from US$18 to $10 ahead of the company's Q4 2022 earnings release. The downgrade is primarily attributed to the uncertainty surrounding federal regulatory reform in the cannabis industry and nagging operating headwinds, rather than the company's operational performance. Other analysts, like Cowen's Vivien Azer, also hold a dim view on the prospects of near-term federal cannabis reform.

feed.title: Micron Sells Out 2026 HBM4 As US$200b AI Capacity Plan Grows
feed.summary: Micron Technology has sold out its entire 2026 production of HBM4, its next-generation high bandwidth memory, through multi-year contracts, driven by increasing AI-related memory demand. The company also plans a US$200 billion expansion of its U.S. manufacturing capacity to address the strained industry supply. This strategic move aims to provide Micron with better revenue visibility, though the significant capital expenditure and potential competitive responses present risks.

feed.title: Crown Castle (CCI) Valuation Check As Fiber Sale Plan And Dividend Questions Refocus Investor Attention
feed.summary: Crown Castle (CCI) recently affirmed a quarterly cash dividend of $1.0625 per share, attracting investor attention. Despite a 5.35% decline in share price over 90 days and a 26.97% decline over five years, the company is considered 12.6% undervalued with a fair value of $98.91 per share, primarily leveraging its plan to sell its fiber segment and focus on the U.S. tower business. The valuation, however, depends on successful execution of the fiber sale and tower focus, with potential risks from uncertainty surrounding EchoStar, Dish, and Sprint churn.

feed.title: HP Q1 2026 earnings: revenue beats, but HP flags cost headwinds
feed.summary: HP (HPQ) reported Q1 2026 results beating revenue and adjusted earnings expectations, but cautioned that rising component and trade-related costs will impact profitability throughout the year. The company saw a 6.9% increase in net revenue to $14.4 billion, driven largely by an 11% rise in Personal Systems revenue, while printing revenue experienced a slight decline. HP expects full-year earnings to be at the lower end of its guided range due to these cost pressures and a "fluid operating environment."

feed.title: Truist Lowers its Price Target on Insulet Corporation (PODD) to $360 and Maintains a Buy Rating
feed.summary: Truist lowered its price target on Insulet Corporation (PODD) to $360 from $390 but maintained a Buy rating, citing strong Q4 performance driven by its Omnipod 5 system and growth in Type 2 diabetes. Goldman Sachs also reduced its price target to $326 while keeping a Buy rating, highlighting strong U.S. insulin pump market growth and Insulet's potential for sustained leadership. Insulet reported adjusted EPS of $1.55 and revenue of $783.8M for Q4, exceeding consensus estimates, and expressed confidence in expanding adoption for both Type 1 and Type 2 diabetes in 2026.

feed.title: Morgan Stanley Raises its Price Target on Edison International (EIX) to $68 from $61
feed.summary: Morgan Stanley increased its price target for Edison International (EIX) to $68 from $61, while maintaining an Underweight rating. This update, made on February 20, 2026, reflects a broader adjustment across the utilities sector. Separately, TD Cowen analyst Shelby Tucker also raised Edison's price target to $83 from $71, following the company's strong Q4 earnings, which showed core EPS of $6.55, exceeding consensus.

feed.title: Rocket Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:RCKT) Posts Earnings Results, Beats Expectations By $0.04 EPS
feed.summary: Rocket Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:RCKT) announced its quarterly earnings, reporting an EPS of ($0.38), which beat the consensus estimate by $0.04. The stock saw a trading increase to $4.53, with a market capitalization of $490 million, despite some insider selling by the CEO and General Counsel. Analysts currently hold a consensus "Hold" rating for RCKT with an average price target of $14.36.

feed.title: DOCOMO Cooperating on Open RAN Initiatives with 5 Global Operators
feed.summary: NTT DOCOMO is expanding its Open RAN (Radio Access Network) initiatives by cooperating with five global telecom operators: KT Corporation, Vodafone Group, Smart Communications Inc., DISH Wireless, and Singtel. This collaboration aims to promote the Open RAN concept, which uses open and standardized wireless base-station specifications to enable multi-vendor interconnection in mobile networks. DOCOMO has also launched the "OREX" brand to support international operators in deploying Open RAN systems, leveraging its expertise in constructing multi-vendor networks since the 4G era.

feed.title: KDP not worried about decline in at-home coffee consumption
feed.summary: Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) is not concerned about the 6% decline in at-home coffee consumption in 2022, attributing it to shifting consumer mobility post-COVID-19. Despite this, the company's single-serve coffee systems and pods gained market share, and KDP met its goal of selling 2 million Keurig systems. KDP leaders believe at-home coffee consumption has significant long-term tailwinds and expect a recovery as mobility improves.

feed.title: Goldman Sachs Raises its Price Target on A. O. Smith Corporation (AOS) to $69 from $63
feed.summary: Goldman Sachs analyst Susan Maklari raised the price target on A. O. Smith Corporation (AOS) to $69 from $63, maintaining a Sell rating due to anticipated deceleration in housing and industry dynamics. However, Stifel and Baird analysts also updated their price targets to $85 (Buy) and $77 (Neutral) respectively, following the company's Q4 EPS beat despite light 2026 revenue guidance. A. O. Smith reported Q4 adjusted EPS of 90c, exceeding consensus, with CEO Steve Shafer highlighting improved profitability and strength in commercial markets.

feed.title: Argus Research Cuts Price Target on Gen Digital Inc. (GEN) Citing Impact From Tech Selloff
feed.summary: Argus Research has lowered its price target for Gen Digital Inc. (GEN) to $32 from $35 due to the current tech selloff, while still maintaining a Buy rating. Analyst Joseph Bonner believes the company's fundamentals are sound and concerns about AI agents threatening cybersecurity software are overstated. Gen Digital, known for brands like Norton and LifeLock, also recently partnered with Vercel to integrate safety checks for AI skill packages.

feed.title: Analysts See Over 50% Upside To Booking Holdings Inc. (BKNG)
feed.summary: Booking Holdings Inc. (BKNG) is considered a strong buy with a 50.5% average upside potential according to analysts. Morgan Stanley upgraded the stock to Overweight, while Citigroup reiterated a Buy rating, both noting the company's strong performance in its recent quarter with revenue and profit beating estimates. The company, which owns platforms like Booking.com and Kayak, saw increased room nights and attributed its improved financial results to steady demand for international travel.

feed.title: eToro Teams Up with Sentifi to Launch Social Sentiment Portfolio
feed.summary: eToro has partnered with alternative data provider Sentifi to launch its new SocialSentiment portfolio. This offering focuses on U.S. companies from the S&P 500 that meet high ESG criteria and demonstrate positive social sentiment, as analyzed by Sentifi's AI technology. The portfolio, rebalanced monthly, allows investors to access stocks discussed positively on social channels, with a minimum investment of $500, though it is not available in the U.S.

feed.title: Meet Dan Poland: Our Chief Supply Chain Officer
feed.summary: This article introduces Dan Poland, Executive Vice President and Chief Supply Chain Officer at Campbell's, highlighting his background in food and agriculture. It details how supply chain operations align with Campbell's values ("5 Cs") and discusses the company's "Campbell’s Way of Working" initiative aimed at improving efficiency and employee engagement. Poland also shares career advice and his favorite Campbell's Chunky soup varieties.

feed.title: Ambrose, Vertex Pharmaceuticals SVP, sells $108k in VRTX stock
feed.summary: Kristen Ambrose, SVP & Chief Accounting Officer at Vertex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:VRTX), sold 223 shares of common stock for $108,456 on February 25, 2026, and an additional 546 shares for $264,870 on February 24, 2026, through a pre-arranged trading plan. Despite the insider sale and the stock appearing overvalued, Vertex maintains a "GREAT" financial health score and has seen strong returns, with analysts raising price targets due to promising pipeline developments.

feed.title: 3D Tissue Models Mimic the Human Immune System to Inform Drug Development
feed.summary: Amgen's research site in Burnaby, British Columbia, is developing 3D tissue models using human tonsil tissue and bioprinting technology to predict how the human immune system will react to new drugs. These models aim to identify potential immune responses early in drug development, reducing the risk of clinical trial failures. The team also plans to use bioprinted tissues for antibody discovery, allowing for customized immune responses.

feed.title: Morgan Stanley Trims Price Target on EPAM Systems, Inc. (EPAM) to $160, Keeps Equal Weight Rating
feed.summary: Morgan Stanley has lowered its price target for EPAM Systems (EPAM) to $160 from $175, maintaining an Equal Weight rating. This adjustment followed EPAM's conservative Q1 2026 earnings forecast, which led to a 16% premarket slump in shares. Despite the reduction, Goldman Sachs reiterated a Buy rating, viewing the share price drop as an overreaction.

feed.title: Dr Reddys Laboratories Upgraded to Hold on Technical and Valuation Improvements
feed.summary: Dr Reddy's Laboratories Ltd. has been upgraded from a Sell to a Hold rating as of February 26, 2026, due to improvements in technical indicators, valuation, and fundamental financial trends. While the company's long-term financials remain strong, recent quarterly results showed some weakness. The upgrade reflects a stabilization in price momentum and attractive valuation despite slower profit growth, warranting a cautious outlook.

feed.title: Ready Capital (NYSE:RC) Issues Earnings Results, Beats Estimates By $0.02 EPS
feed.summary: Ready Capital (NYSE:RC) reported Q4 earnings of ($0.09) per share, surpassing analyst estimates by $0.02, with revenue of $207.55 million also exceeding expectations. Despite beating estimates, the company's profitability metrics remain weak, showing a negative return on equity and net margin. Ready Capital also announced a significant cut in its quarterly dividend to $0.01 and its stock is trading near its 1-year low, with analysts maintaining a "Reduce" rating and lowered price targets.

feed.title: Analysts Offer Insights on Industrial Goods Companies: BELIMO Holding AG (OtherBLHWF) and Quanta Services (PWR)
feed.summary: This article provides analyst insights on two industrial goods companies: BELIMO Holding AG and Quanta Services. Jefferies maintained a Buy rating on BELIMO Holding AG with a target price of CHF1013.00, while Bernstein maintained a Hold rating on Quanta Services with a target of $515.00. The article also notes the general Street consensus for both companies.

feed.title: Playtika (PLTK) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
feed.summary: Playtika (PLTK) reported strong Q4 2025 results, with total revenue up 4.4% year-over-year and direct-to-consumer (D2C) revenue reaching $250.1 million. The company is actively shifting its portfolio towards casual games, which now account for 74% of total revenue, driven by the exceptional performance of SuperPlay titles like Disney Solitaire. Despite a net loss due to non-cash contingent consideration for the SuperPlay earn-out, Playtika achieved record free cash flow and suspended its dividend to prioritize capital flexibility for high-return investments and the SuperPlay earn-out.

feed.title: PLDT income eases 7%; data center REIT plan under study
feed.summary: PLDT Inc.'s attributable net income decreased by 7.12% to P30.01 billion in 2025 due to higher expenses and flat core earnings. The company is now considering a real estate investment trust (REIT) listing for its data center business, VITRO, after abandoning plans to sell a minority stake, as potential investors sought majority control. Maya Group, jointly owned by PLDT and First Pacific Co. Ltd., reported its first full-year profit, with an IPO targeted for the second half of the year.

feed.title: Expedia Group, Inc. (EXPE) a Moderate Buy, Per Wall Street
feed.summary: Expedia Group, Inc. (EXPE) has received a consensus Moderate Buy rating from Wall Street analysts, with an average upside potential of 46.5%. While some analysts like Citigroup's Ronald Josey have cut price targets, BMO Capital recently raised its target due to strong Q4 revenue and earnings beat. The company reported $3.54 billion in revenue, up 11.4% year-over-year, and beat profit estimates, but faces caution regarding increased marketing spending and a muted full-year outlook due to macroeconomic uncertainty.

feed.title: Adobe Inc. (ADBE)'s Upside Potential at 71% Despite Recent Price Target Reductions
feed.summary: Adobe Inc. (ADBE) has an average upside potential of 70.9% despite recent price target reductions by Jefferies, HSBC, and Piper Sandler due to concerns over AI competition and sector sentiment. The company, known for its creative software, maintains a Moderate Buy rating. The article suggests that while Adobe has potential, other AI stocks might offer better short-term upside with less risk.

feed.title: Morgan Stanley Trims Price Target on EPAM Systems, Inc. (EPAM) to $160, Keeps Equal Weight Rating
feed.summary: Morgan Stanley has lowered its price target for EPAM Systems (EPAM) to $160 from $175, while maintaining an Equal Weight rating, following the company's Q4 earnings call and a cautious outlook for 2026. Goldman Sachs also trimmed its price target but reiterated a Buy rating, viewing the stock's slump as an overreaction. EPAM, a provider of digital and AI transformation services, has projected Q1 2026 revenue between $1.38 billion and $1.40 billion, with adjusted profit per share between $2.70 and $2.78.

feed.title: Analysts See Over 50% Upside To Booking Holdings Inc. (BKNG)
feed.summary: Booking Holdings Inc. (BKNG) is considered a Strong Buy with an average upside potential of 50.5%, according to analysts. Morgan Stanley upgraded the stock to Overweight, while Citigroup reiterated a Buy rating, citing Booking's strong Q4 performance with a 16% revenue increase and 9% rise in room nights year-over-year. The company's ability to retain customers and leverage passenger information for direct business were highlighted as key strengths.

feed.title: Netflix Just Lost the Fight for Warner Bros. It’s Still the One to Beat
feed.summary: Netflix has withdrawn its bid for Warner Bros. Discovery assets, citing "financial discipline" after Paramount Skydance made a superior all-cash offer for the entire company, including its legacy cable networks. While Netflix's proposal focused on valuable IP like HBO, Paramount is acquiring WBD's substantial debt and less valuable linear television assets. Despite losing this battle, Netflix's strategic decision to avoid taking on WBD's full debt and less desirable assets highlights its continued strength and focused approach in the streaming industry.

feed.title: Pursuit Attractions And Hospitality (PRSU) Returns To Profitability, Testing Premium Valuation Narratives
feed.summary: Pursuit Attractions and Hospitality (PRSU) has returned to profitability, reporting a trailing twelve-month net income of US$24.9 million, up from a US$150.6 million loss. Despite this, its revenue growth of 3.8% lags the broader US market, and its P/E ratio of 39.7x is significantly higher than peers and its DCF fair value. The company's premium valuation is being tested by its slower revenue growth and exposure to risks affecting high-demand destinations.

feed.title: McDonald’s Korea wraps up 2026 manager convention
feed.summary: McDonald's Korea recently concluded its 2026 Manager Convention, bringing together 1,400 managers from 400 restaurants nationwide. The event, held in three sessions throughout February, aimed to recognize managers' efforts, strengthen organizational solidarity, and boost morale through various programs and discussions on operational priorities. The company emphasizes its people-centered management philosophy by investing in employee development and promoting internal mobility, with about half of its headquarters staff having started their careers in restaurants.

feed.title: Perimeter Solutions (PRM) Q4 Loss Concentration Reinforces Bearish Profitability Narratives
feed.summary: Perimeter Solutions (PRM) reported its FY 2025 results, showing a Q4 revenue of US$102.8 million and a basic EPS loss of US$0.94. The company remains unprofitable on a trailing 12-month basis with a net income loss of US$206.4 million, heavily concentrated in Q4 2025 which saw a US$140.2 million loss. Despite a forecasted revenue growth of 11.9% per year, the stock trades at a premium P/S of 5.3x compared to industry averages, raising questions about its valuation amidst ongoing losses.

feed.title: Phathom Pharmaceuticals (PHAT) Losses Narrow To US$0.29 EPS And Test Bullish Profitability Narrative
feed.summary: Phathom Pharmaceuticals (PHAT) reported Q4 2025 revenue of US$57.6 million and a narrowed basic EPS loss of US$0.29, with a net loss of US$21.1 million. While revenue growth is strong, trailing 12-month net losses remain substantial at US$221.25 million, raising questions about the company's path to profitability and challenging the bullish narrative that anticipates 25.4% margins within three years. Despite the narrowing quarterly losses, the overall financial health, including negative shareholders' equity, indicates that profitability is still a significant work in progress.

feed.title: Telstra, Ericsson and Qualcomm Achieve 682 Mbps 5G Uplink
feed.summary: Telstra, Ericsson, and Qualcomm have achieved a new global 5G Standalone uplink speed record of 682 Mbps on Telstra's live commercial network in Queensland, Australia. This significant increase from 516 Mbps in February 2025 will enhance consumer experiences such as faster uploads, more reliable live streaming, and more responsive real-time applications, particularly during peak times. The advancement leverages Ericsson's 5G Advanced Uplink Transmit Switching features, Telstra's mid-band 5G spectrum, and Qualcomm's X85 5G Modem-RF platform.

feed.title: Derek Stark Sells 1,903 Shares of PennyMac Financial Services (NYSE:PFSI) Stock
feed.summary: Derek Stark, an insider at PennyMac Financial Services (NYSE:PFSI), sold 1,903 shares of the company's stock for a total of $174,124.50, reducing his holding by 7.81%. This sale occurred shortly after PennyMac missed its quarterly earnings and revenue estimates. Despite the earnings miss and a "Hold" average analyst rating, the company announced a quarterly dividend of $0.30 per share.

feed.title: Eversource Energy: What Wall Street Missed About This Quiet Utility
feed.summary: Eversource Energy, a utility serving over 4 million customers in New England, is undergoing a significant transition towards cleaner energy, grid modernization, and facing regulatory challenges. This pivot involves substantial investments in infrastructure hardening against extreme weather and integrating renewables, particularly offshore wind. While this aims to improve reliability and promote clean power, it also leads to increased costs for consumers and balancing acts for regulators, impacting both customer bills and investor perceptions of the stock's stability.

feed.title: Analysts Offer Insights on Industrial Goods Companies: Lennox International (LII) and Deere (DE)
feed.summary: Analysts have issued neutral ratings for Lennox International (LII) and Deere (DE), indicating neither bullish nor bearish sentiment on these industrial goods stocks. RBC Capital's Deane Dray maintained a Hold rating on Lennox International with a $587.00 price target, while Bernstein's Chad Dillard also maintained a Hold rating on Deere with a $615.00 price target. Both companies received downgrades to Hold from TipRanks – OpenAI.

feed.title: Xcel Energy asks for two rate hikes in Colorado; some customers say they're fed up
feed.summary: Xcel Energy is seeking approval from the Public Utility Commission for proposed rate increases: nearly 10% for electricity and 11% for gas, citing infrastructure investments. This has led to protests from customers who argue that the company's substantial profits should cover these costs without further burdening ratepayers. Xcel Energy, however, maintains that these investments are crucial for clean, reliable, and safe energy delivery, emphasizing their commitment to balancing reliability, sustainability, and affordability.

feed.title: Is Uber Technologies Stock Underperforming the Nasdaq?
feed.summary: Uber Technologies (UBER) has underperformed the Nasdaq Composite (NASX) across several timeframes, including the past three months, year-to-date, and the past 52 weeks. The company's shares dropped after forecasting Q1 2026 gross bookings and adjusted core profit below expectations, despite beating revenue estimates in Q4 2025. Despite this underperformance, analysts maintain a "Strong Buy" consensus rating for UBER, with a significant upside potential from current price levels.

feed.title: Cathie Wood Seeing AI Gold In Amazon And Baidu? Ark Invest Is Betting On These Stocks Today
feed.summary: Ark Invest, led by Cathie Wood, made significant trades on Thursday, increasing its holdings in Amazon.com Inc. and Baidu Inc., while reducing its stake in Salesforce Inc. The firm purchased Amazon shares despite a stock decline, citing BofA Securities' optimistic outlook on AWS's AI-driven growth. Ark Invest also acquired a substantial amount of Baidu stock across multiple funds, as the Chinese tech giant continues to invest heavily in AI despite a recent revenue decline.

feed.title: Avidity Biosciences Announces Multiple Upcoming Presentations at 2026 Muscular Dystrophy Association Clinical & Scientific Conference
feed.summary: Avidity Biosciences (Nasdaq: RNA) announced it will present one oral and six poster presentations at the 2026 Muscular Dystrophy Association (MDA) Clinical & Scientific Conference. The presentations will cover new data from their EXPLORE44 program for Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD44) and insights into myotonic dystrophy type 1 (DM1) and facioscapulohumeral muscular dystrophy (FSHD). Additionally, Avidity will host an industry forum lunch focusing on biomarker advancements in rare neuromuscular diseases.

feed.title: Relay Therapeutics Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2025 Financial Results and Outlines Anticipated 2026 Milestones
feed.summary: Relay Therapeutics announced its fourth quarter and full-year 2025 financial results, alongside anticipated milestones for 2026, primarily focusing on its zovegalisib program. The company expects to present initial Phase 1 data for zovegalisib in PIK3CA-driven vascular anomalies, breast cancer triplet data, and frontline Phase 3 plans in 2026. As of Q4 2025, Relay Therapeutics reported approximately $555 million in cash, cash equivalents, and investments, projected to fund operations into 2029.

feed.title: Milwaukee joins other municipalities in suing fire truck manufacturers
feed.summary: The City of Milwaukee has filed a lawsuit against three fire truck manufacturers—REV Group, Oshkosh Corp., and Rosenbauer America—accusing them of colluding to inflate prices and limit supply. This action joins a federal class-action lawsuit initiated by the City of La Crosse, alleging that these companies used the Fire Apparatus Manufacturers' Association to facilitate anticompetitive practices. Milwaukee city officials emphasize that taxpayers bear the burden of these increased costs for essential emergency equipment, and the litigation aims to ensure fair competition and protect public safety.

feed.title: OPEN - Opendoor Technologies Inc Latest Stock News & Market Updates
feed.summary: This page provides the latest news and updates for Opendoor Technologies Inc. (Nasdaq: OPEN), an e-commerce platform for residential real estate transactions. It includes company press releases, earnings communications, and regulatory updates, highlighting leadership changes, financial results, strategic objectives, and shareholder programs such as special dividends and warrant distributions. The company is actively focusing on AI integration and pursuing a path to profitability.
